Posts.Content: Aims84 Thank you I managed to tolerate the cold cap and I am not at all anxious about doing it again. So far I have felt fairly ok.  Hope all goes well for you and that we both get good results for cold cap and chmo
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Thank you Aims84. The weather has been wonderful and I have a few lovely walks.  I hope all is going ok for you. I have been too bad but this is only the first Take good care Veliz
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: I start chemo on May 4th as well. EC-T x3. Zoledronate acid infusions on 2nd 4th &6th. Plus Herceptin on 4th and 6th. Quite a cocktail. Going to try the cold cap. Look forward to reading all your comments in the May chemo club All the very best to everyone
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Aims84 Well done on the cold. It’s my turn tomorrow and hoping I can manage it. Had a picc line fitted today ready for the chemo tomorrow  Hope all goes well for you Veliz
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hello Sunnyone i don’t often post but do have a read of the messages from time to time. I walk in Knaresborough usually twice a week. I live just up the road in Harrogate. Lovely pictures. Veliz
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hello Leolady  Hope all goes well for you tomorrow  Veliz x
Posts.Title: Results Back - now waiting for Oncotype DX

Posts.Content: Thank you once again for your support and advise. I am fair skinned so bruise easily. This is the worst I have had. Have taken arnica It’s a strange and scary journey but I trying to stay positive and continue with all my usual activities. I think it will be more difficult after surgery but won’t stop trying
Posts.Title: Bruised

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reassurance. It is so helpful when people share their experiences, I feel less alone
Posts.Title: Bruised

Posts.Content: Thank you for your advise and reassurance. Good luck to you too. We all need kind words on this strange and fearful journey. The medical team have been wonderful and I do feel looked after x
Posts.Title: Bruised

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reassurance and advise x
Posts.Title: Bruised

Posts.Content: I had a biopsy to a lymph node 10 days ago and I am still very bruised. Has anyone out there experienced this?
Posts.Title: Bruised

Posts.Content: I start EC-T chemo on 4th May, 6 cycles. I am having zoledronate acid on cycle 2 4 &6. Plus herceptin on cycle 4 & 6 Is any one else having this cocktail? Wishing everybody an easy journey X
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady I have had my first EC. Not too bad so far. I don’t suffer with head aches so the cold cap was ok. Just hope it works. Having a wig fitting just in case. My great nephew said I would look like Uncle Fester if I went bald Hope all goes well with your next chemo. I too have a picc line. Think it should be offered to everyone Good luck Veliz
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Annie6 Thank you so much for your reply. I had my first EClast Friday. No real side effects so far but still on steroids, so waiting to see what happens. I refuse to cancel any of my arrangements unless I have too. To help things along I have arranged a little help with house work and gardening. My lovely neighbour has done most of my ironing  Please let me know how you get on with the Pacitaxol and I may discuss this with the onco. He he a really good guy and does listen. Many thanks again Veliz
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well Leolady Veliz
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
